Refer Fig. 1 to answer the following questions.


Fig. 1. Circuit configuration of push-pull converter.


1. The feasible range of duty ratio for the switches (Q1 and Q2) is:

explanations.c: Explanation 3: Push-pull converter switches are given complementary pulses with a dead time. Hence, duty ratio should be below 50 %.

questions.question: 2. The frequency of the inductor current compared to the frequency of switches is?

explanations.a: Explanation 1: Due to the structure and gating scheme of the push-pull converter, the inductor current has a frequency twice that of the switching frequency.

questions.question: 3. The purpose of transformer in push-pull converter is?

answers.a: Voltage ratio transformation and electrical isolation

explanations.a: Explanation 1: The presence of transformer provides electrical isolation between the input and output load. Also, its turns ratio provides a voltage scaling on the load side.

questions.question: 5. The gating scheme of the two switches (Q<sub>1</sub> and Q<sub>2</sub>) is:

answers.b: 180° phase shifted PWM signals with sufficient dead time
answers.d: Synchronized PWM signals with sufficient dead time

explanations.b: Explanation 2: In push-pull converter, two switches are present that are given complementary gate pulses with suitable dead time.
